@graph.name: Roasted Pumpkin with Yogurt Sauce and Pine Nuts
@graph.description: Roasted Pumpkin with Yogurt Sauce and Pine Nuts

@graph.headline: Roasted Pumpkin with Yogurt Sauce and Pine Nuts

@graph.name: Roasted Pumpkin with Yogurt Sauce and Pine Nuts
recipeIngredient: 1.2kg / 2.4 lb pumpkin , skin on seeds in weight (or butternut squash or sweet potato, Note 1)
1 garlic clove , finely minced using garlic press
3/4 cup Greek yogurt (or other plain, non sweet yogurt)
1/2 small garlic clove, finely minced using garlic press
2 tbsp pine nuts (or other nuts of choice)
2 tbsp fresh coriander/cilantro leaves , roughly chopped (or parsley)
1/8 tsp sumac (paprika or other theme appropriate spice, Note 2)

recipeInstructions.text: Preheat oven to 220°C/430°F (200°C fan). Line a tray with baking/parchment paper.
recipeInstructions.name: Preheat oven to 220°C/430°F (200°C fan). Line a tray with baking/parchment paper.

recipeInstructions.text: Peel, deseed and cut pumpkin into 3cm / 1.2" cubes – see photos in post for how I do it with little effort. You should end up with about 1 kg – enough to fill a tray.
recipeInstructions.name: Peel, deseed and cut pumpkin into 3cm / 1.2" cubes – see photos in post for how I do it with little effort. You should end up with about 1 kg – enough to fill a tray.

recipeInstructions.text: Place pumpkin in a bowl, add garlic, salt, pepper and olive oil. Toss well using a rubber spatula.
recipeInstructions.name: Place pumpkin in a bowl, add garlic, salt, pepper and olive oil. Toss well using a rubber spatula.

recipeInstructions.text: Spread on tray. Roast 20 minutes. Turn pumpkin pieces, then roast a further 7 to 10 minutes until nicely coloured but holding it's shape, rather than being a mushy mess.
recipeInstructions.name: Spread on tray. Roast 20 minutes. Turn pumpkin pieces, then roast a further 7 to 10 minutes until nicely coloured but holding it's shape, rather than being a mushy mess.

recipeInstructions.text: Mix ingredients then set aside for at least 10 minutes to let the flavours develop.
recipeInstructions.name: Mix ingredients then set aside for at least 10 minutes to let the flavours develop.

recipeInstructions.text: Preheat skillet over medium high heat (no oil). Add pine nuts and cook, stirring regularly, until it smells amazing and it's got a hint of browning on both sides. Remove from pan.
recipeInstructions.name: Preheat skillet over medium high heat (no oil). Add pine nuts and cook, stirring regularly, until it smells amazing and it's got a hint of browning on both sides. Remove from pan.

recipeInstructions.text: Pile the pumpkin in a mound on a plate. Drizzle over yogurt sauce, add a little drizzle of olive oil, then sprinkle with sumac, pine nuts and coriander.
recipeInstructions.name: Pile the pumpkin in a mound on a plate. Drizzle over yogurt sauce, add a little drizzle of olive oil, then sprinkle with sumac, pine nuts and coriander.

recipeInstructions.text: I think it's best served with the pumpkin hot or warm, but for a warm summer day, it is also excellent served at room temperature. Just cool pumpkin, then dress and garnish just before serving.
recipeInstructions.name: I think it's best served with the pumpkin hot or warm, but for a warm summer day, it is also excellent served at room temperature. Just cool pumpkin, then dress and garnish just before serving.
